gurmukhi: ਕਰ ਕੰਗਨ ਪਹੁਚੀ ੳੁਜਿਅਾਰੰ ॥ ਨਿਰਖ ਮਦਨ ਦੁਤ ਹੋਤ ਸੁ ਮਾਰੰ ॥੫੯੪॥
transliteration: Kar Kanad Pagouchiujiaaran|| Nirakh Madan Dout Hot Su Maaran||594||
translation: The bracelets of their hands are spreading brightness and seeing such elegance the beauty of the god of love is getting dim.594.

gurmukhi: ਸੋਭਿਤ ਛਬਿ ਧਾਰੰ ਕਚ ਘੁੰਘਰਾਰੰ ਰਸਨ ਰਸਾਰੰ ੳੁਜਿਅਾਰੰ ॥ ਪਹੁੰਚੀ ਗਜਰਾਰੰ ਸੁਬਿਧ ਸੁਧਾਰੰ ਮੁਕਤ ਨਿਹਾਰੰ ੳੁਰ ਧਾਰੰ ॥
transliteration: Sobhit Chhab(i) Dhaaran Kach Ghnghraaran Rasan Rasaaran Ujiaaran|| Pahounchigadraaran Soubidh Sudhaaran Moukt Nihaaran Ur Dhaaran||
translation: With black hair sweet speech they appear very impressive and moving freely, they are roaming within the jostling of the elephants.

gurmukhi: ਸੋਹਤ ਚਖ ਚਾਰੰ ਰੰਗ ਰੰਗਾਰੰ ਬਿਬਿਧ ਪ੍ਰਕਾਰੰ ਅਤਿ ਅਾਂਜੇ ॥ ਬਿਖ ਧਰ ਮ੍ਰਿਗ ਜੈਸੇ ਜਲ ਜਨ ਵੈਸੇ ਸਸੀਅਰ ਜੈਸੇ ਸਰ ਮਾਂਜੇ ॥੫੯੫॥
transliteration: Sohat Chakh Chaaran Ran Ranadran Bibidh Prakaaran At(i) Aanje|| Bikh Dhar Mrig Jaise Jal Jan Vaise Saseear Jaise Sar Maanje||595||
translation: With antimony in their eyes and dyed in various coulurs they look splendid with their beautiful eyes. In this way, their eyes, assaulting like poisonous serpents, but innocent like deer, they are winsome like lotus and moon.595.

gurmukhi: ਭਯੋ ਮੂੜ ਰਾਵਣ ਰਣ ਕ੍ਰੁੱਧੰ ॥ ਮੱਚਿਓ ਅਾਨ ਤੁਮੱਲ ਜਬ ਜੁੱਧੰ ॥ ਜੂਝੇ ਸਕਲ ਸੂਰਮਾਂ ਸੁੱਧੰ ॥ ਅਰ ਦਲ ਮੱਧਿ ਸਬਦ ਕਰ ੳੁੱਧੰ ॥੫੯੬॥
transliteration: Bhayo Moond Raavan Ran Kruddhan|| Machchio Aan Toumall Jah Juddhan|| Joojjhe Sakal Soormaan Suddhan|| Ar Dal Maddh(i) Sabad Kar Uddhan||596||
translation: The foolish Ravana was highly infuriated in the war; when the terrible war began amidst violent resonance, all the warriors began to fight and roam shouting violently among the enemy forces.596.

gurmukhi: ਧਾਯੋ ਕਰ ਕ੍ਰੁੱਧੰ ਸੁਭਟ ਬਿਰੁੱਧੰ ਗਲਿਤ ਸੁਬੁੱਧੰ ਗਹਿ ਬਾਣੰ ॥ ਕੀਨੋ ਰਣ ਸੁੱਧੰ ਨਚਤ ਕਬੁੱਧੰ ਅਤ ਧੁਨ ੳੁੱਧੰ ਧਨੁ ਤਾਣੰ ॥
transliteration: Dhaayo Kar Kruddhan Soubhat Biruddhan Gadit Soubuddhan Gad(i) Baanan|| Keeno Ran Suddhan Nachat Kabuddhan At Dhoun Uddhan Dhan(u) Taanan||
translation: That demon of vicious intellect, holding arrows in his hand and highly enraged marched forward to wage a war. He fought a terrible war and amidst the pulled up bows in the battlefield, the headless trunks began to dance.

gurmukhi: ਧਾੲੇ ਰਜਵਾਰੇ ਦੁੱਧਰ ਹਕਾਰੇ ਸੁ ਬ੍ਰਣ ਪ੍ਹਾਰੇ ਕਰ ਕੋਪੰ ॥ ਘਾੲਿਨ ਤਨ ਰੱਜੇ ਦੁ ਪਗ ਨ ਭੱਜੇ ਜਨੁ ਹਰ ਗੱਜੇ ਪਗ ਰੋਪੰ ॥੫੯੭॥
transliteration: Dhaae Rajvdare Duddhar Hakdare Su Bran Prahdare Kar Kopan|| Ghaain Tan Rajje Du Pag Ne Bhajje Jan(u) Har Gadje Pag Ropan||597||
translation: The king moved forward while challenging and inflicting wounds on the warriors, they were in great ire; the wounds were inflicted on the bodies of the fighters, but still they are not fleeing and thundering like clouds, they are firmly standing and fighti

gurmukhi: ਅਧਿਕ ਰੋਸ ਸਾਵਤ ਰਨ ਜੂਟੇ ॥ ਬਖਤਰ ਟੋਪ ਜਿਰੈ ਸਭ ਫੂਟੇ ॥ ਨਿਸਰ ਚਲੇ ਸਾੲਿਕ ਜਨ ਛੂਟੇ ॥ ਜਨਿਕ ਸਿਚਾਨ ਮਾਸ ਲਖ ਟੂਟੇ ॥
transliteration: Adhik Ros Saavai Ran Jeete|| Bakhtarto Jirai Sabh Phoote|| Nidar Chale Saaikjan Chhodhte|| Janik Sichaan Maas Lakh Toote||598||
translation: With the increase of indignation the warriors attacked each other and the armours and helmets were shattered, the arrows were discharged from bows and the bits of flesh fell on being chopped form the bodies of the enemies.598.

gurmukhi: ਸਾੲਿਕ ਜਣੁ ਛੂਟੇ ਤਿਮ ਅਰਿ ਜੂਟੇ ਬਖਤਰ ਫੂਟੇ ਜੇਬ ਜਿਰੇ ॥ ਮਸਹਰ ਭੁਖਿਅਾੲੇ ਤਿਮੁ ਅਰਿ ਧਾੲੇ ਸੱਸਤ੍ਰ ਨਚਾੲਿਨ ਫੇਰਿ ਫਿਰੇਂ ॥
transliteration: Saaik Jan(u) Chhodhte Tim Ar(i) Jeete Bakhtar Phnte Jeb Jire|| Mas-har Bhoukhiaae Tim(u) Ar(i) Dhaae Sasstra Nachaain Pher(i) Phiren||
translation: As soon as the arrows are discharged, the enemies in still greather numbers gather and prepare to fight even with the shattered armour; they move forward and run like a hungry person here and there; they are roaming hither and thither, striking their weap

gurmukhi: ਸਨਮੁਖਿ ਰਣ ਗਾਜੈਂ ਕਿਮਹੂੰ ਨ ਭਾਜੈਂ ਲਖ ਸੁਰ ਲਾਜੈਂ ਰਣ ਰੰਗੰ ॥ ਜੈਜੈ ਧੁਨ ਕਰਹੀ ਪੁਹਪਨ ਡਰਹੀ ਸੁ ਬਿਧਿ ੳੁਚਰਹੀ ਜੈ ਜੰਗੰ ॥੫੯੯॥
transliteration: Sanmoukh(i) Ran Gadjain Kimhoon Na Bhaajain Lakh Sur Laajain Ran Ranadg|| Jaijai Dhoun Kar-hipuhpan Dar-hisu Bidh(i) Ouchar-hijai Janadg||599||
translation: They fight face to face and don not run away; seeing them waging war even the gods feel shy. The gods seeing the terrible war shower flowers with the sound of ‘hail, hail; they also hail the fight in the war arena.599.
